title: British workers handed biggest pay rise in six years but unemployment in shock rise
text:
British workers handed biggest pay rise in six years but unemployment in shock rise British workers handed biggest pay rise in six years but unemployment in shock rise BRITAIN's wages have jumped up at the fastest pace in more than six years, but unemployment increased for the third month in a row, showed a mixed set of official data released today. PUBLISHED: 10:50, Wed, Sep 16, 2015 | UPDATED: 12:36, Wed, Sep 16, 2015 GETTY UK pay is rising at the fastest pace since 2009 
Salaries in the three months to July increased by a bumper 2.9 per cent compared with the same period last year, according to the Office for National Statistics (ONS). The last time pay increases were higher was in January 2009. It comes just a day after data revealed that the cost of living remains frozen, handing household an added spending boost. Average pay (without bonuses) now stands at Â£465 a week before tax, according to the ONS. However, unemployment increased for the third month in a row - the first time this has happened since 2011.The jobless amount grew by 10,000 between May and July, to 1.82 million to stand at a rate kf 5.5 per cent in the three months to July 2015 The number of people claiming unemployment-related benefits last month also jumped by 1,200 to 791,700, said the ONS.The employment rate is now at 73.5 per cent.
